availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Smith (Woodford County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and Versailles trustee)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, cabinetmaker and politician. Woodford County, Kentucky, native. Filed a marriage bond to Catherine Ann Burch Smith in Jessamine County, Kentucky, on June 24, 1835. Father of John H. Smith, Albert C. Smith, Eudora Smith, Andrew F. Smith, Charles W. Smith, Thomas W. Smith, Kate Smith, Gertrude Smith, and Lou Smith. Cabinetmaker in Woodford County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Delegate for Woodford County at the Kentucky Democratic Convention in Frankfort in 1859. Cabinetmaker in Woodford County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Member of the Versailles Board of Trustees in Woodford County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

“Democratic Meeting in Woodford.” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), Nov. 11, 1859.
